data.title: Ares Management taps Kipp deVeer, Blair Jacobson as co-presidents
data.description:
Ares Management (NYSE:ARES) has appointed Kipp deVeer and Blair Jacobson to the newly created positions of co-presidents, effective immediately.

deVeer, who joined Ares in 2004, has been a key architect in founding and building the Ares Credit Group. He also served as chief executive officer of Ares Capital (ARCC) since 2014.

Jacobson, meanwhile, joined Ares in 2012 to build its European Direct Lending platform.

Both professionals will transition from their day-to-day management in the Credit Group to work closely with Ares CEO Michael Arougheti to help drive firm-wide strategic and operational initiatives.

In connection with these appointments, Mitchell Goldstein and Michael Smith will continue to serve as co-heads of Ares’ Credit Group, which they have co-led since 2017.

ARES -3.2% premarket.

data.title: Harley-Davidson GAAP EPS of -$0.93 misses by $0.27, revenue of $688M beats by $217.67M
data.description:
• Harley-Davidson press release (NYSE:HOG): Q4 GAAP EPS of -$0.93 misses by $0.27.
  • Revenue of $688M (-34.5% Y/Y) beats by $217.67M.
  • In the fourth quarter, consolidated revenue was down 35 percent, driven by a revenue decline of 47 percent at HDMC, partially offset by revenue growth of 4 percent at HDFS.
  • For the full year 2025, the Company expects:
    •HDMC: revenue flat to down 5% and operating income margin of 7.0% to 8.0%
    •HDFS: operating income down 10% to 15%
    •LiveWire: electric motorcycle unit sales of 1,000 – 1,500 and an operating loss of $70 to $80 million
    •Harley-Davidson, Inc. diluted earnings per share flat to down 5%
    •Harley-Davidson, Inc: capital investments of $225 to $250 million

data.title: Disney GAAP EPS of $1.40 beats by $0.09, revenue of $24.7B beats by $150M
data.description:
• Disney press release (NYSE:DIS): Q1 GAAP EPS of $1.40 beats by $0.09.
  • Revenue of $24.7B (+5.1% Y/Y) beats by $150M.
  • 178 million Disney+ and Hulu subscriptions, an increase of 0.9 million vs. Q4 fiscal 2024
  • 125 million Disney+ subscribers, a decrease of 0.7 million vs. Q4 fiscal 2024

  • Guidance and Outlook:

    • Star India deconsolidated in Q1:
      • Our India business will contribute $73 million to Entertainment segment operating income in fiscal 2025, compared to $254 million in the prior year; and $9 million to Sports segment operating income, compared to a $636 million loss in the prior year
      • Equity loss from the India JV of $33 million in Q1 primarily due to the impact of purchase accounting; for the full year we expect an equity loss of roughly $300 million driven by purchase accounting
    • Q2 Fiscal 2025:
      • Entertainment Direct-to-Consumer: Modest decline in Disney+ subscribers compared to Q1
      • Sports: Segment operating income adversely impacted by approximately $100 million due to college sports and one additional NFL game, and about $50 million from exiting the Venu Sports JV
      • Experiences: Disney Cruise Line pre-opening expense of approximately $40 million
    • Fiscal Year 2025:
      • High-single digit adjusted EPS growth compared to fiscal 2024
      • Approximately $15 billion in cash provided by operations
      • Entertainment: Double-digit percentage segment operating income growth, with an increase in Entertainment Direct-to-Consumer operating income of approximately $875 million
      • Sports: 13% segment operating income growth
      • Experiences: 6% to 8% segment operating income growth
      • Disney Cruise Line pre-opening expense of ~$200 million

data.title: MarketAxess says total ADV rose 22% Y/Y in January
data.description:
• MarketAxess (NASDAQ:MKTX) said its January total average daily volume (ADV) was up 22% Y/Y to $38.9B.
  • The total ADV was also up 22% as compared to the prior month.
  • Total rates ADV came in at $24.5 billion, up 45% Y/Y and 24% M/M.
  • U.S. high-grade ADV fell 8% to $6.9 Y/Y.
  • Emerging markets ADV of $3.6 billion was down 2% Y/Y, while municipal bond ADV of $535 million increased 32% Y/Y.
  • "While we are disappointed with our U.S. credit market share in January, in the client-initiated channel, we generated record block trading ADV in emerging markets hard currency," CEO, Chris Concannon, said.

data.title: Paypal files for mixed securities shelf
data.description:
• Paypal Holdings (NASDAQ:PYPL) has filed a registration statement with the SEC for a proposed sale of securities.
  • The company may offer from time to time, in one or more offerings, shares of its common stock, preferred stock, depositary shares representing preferred stock, debt securities, warrants, purchase contracts or purchase units.
  • Specific terms of any offering, including the price, will be provided in supplements to this prospectus.

data.title: Boston Scientific Non-GAAP EPS of $0.70 beats by $0.04, revenue of $4.56B beats by $140M
data.description:
• Boston Scientific press release (NYSE:BSX): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.70 beats by $0.04.
  • Revenue of $4.56B (+22.3% Y/Y) beats by $140M.
  • Reported net sales of $4.561 billion, representing an increase of 22.4 percent on a reported basis, compared to the company's guidance range of 16.5 to 18.5 percent; 23.1 percent on an operational basis; and 19.5 percent on an organic basis, compared to the company's guidance range of 14 to 16 percent, all compared to the prior year period.
  • Achieved the following net sales growth in each reportable segment, compared to the prior year period:
    • MedSurg: 12.4 percent reported, 13.0 percent operational and 7.0 percent organic
    • Cardiovascular: 28.8 percent reported, 29.5 percent operational and 27.4 percent organic
  • The company estimates net sales growth for the full year 2025, versus the prior year period, to be in a range of approximately 12.5 to 14.5 percent on a reported basis, and approximately 10 to 12 percent on an organic basis. The company estimates EPS on a GAAP basis in a range of $1.86 to $1.93 and estimates adjusted EPS, excluding certain charges (credits), of $2.80 to $2.87.
  • The company estimates net sales growth for the first quarter of 2025, versus the prior year period, to be in a range of approximately 17 to 19 percent on a reported basis, and approximately 14 to 16 percent on an organic basis.
  • The company estimates EPS on a GAAP basis in a range of $0.43 to $0.45 and estimates adjusted EPS, excluding certain charges (credits), of $0.66 to $0.68.

data.title: Huawei generated over $118B in revenue in 2024 - report
data.description:
Huawei Technologies' generated over 860B yuan (about $118.27B) in revenue in 2024, Reuters reported citing the company's Chairman Liang Hua.

Liang's was speaking at a forum in Guangzhou, according to Shenzhen Business Daily, and was confirmed by Huawei, the report added.

Huawei did not immediately respond to a request for comment from Seeking Alpha.

The 860B yuan revenue in 2024 represents a 22% year-over year growth versus 2023 when the company generated 704.17B yuan.

"In 2024, Huawei's overall operations will meet expectations, ICT infrastructure will remain stable, consumer business will return to growth, and the smart car solution business will develop rapidly, with annual sales revenue exceeding 860 billion yuan," said Liang.

Huawei was once in competition with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Samsung (OTCPK:SSNLF) to be the world's biggest handset maker until U.S. restrictions, starting in 2019, began to curb its access to chip manufacturing tools needed to produce its most advanced models.

However, in the past two years, the Chinese tech giant has been making a comeback. In August 2023, Huawei surprised many by quietly launching its new flagship smartphone, Mate 60 Pro. Last year, the company launched its flagship Mate 70 smartphone, its triple-folding smartphone Mate XT, and also its Pura 70 series.

Huawei's resurgence in the smartphone market in China is among the reasons Apple has been losing market share in the Asian nation.

Apple's iPhone sales fell 18.2% in China in the fourth quarter of 2024, while Huawei had taken the top spot, according to Counterpoint Research. The iPhone also lost the top spot in the smartphone market in China for the full year 2024 to local rivals Vivo and Huawei Technologies, as per research firm Canalys.

data.title: Cencora beats Q1 top-line and bottom-line estimates; updates FY25 outlook
data.description:
• Cencora press release (NYSE:COR): Q1 Non-GAAP EPS of $3.73 beats by $0.21.
  • Revenue of $81.5B (+12.7% Y/Y) beats by $3.28B.
  • Cencora is updating its outlook for fiscal year 2025. The Company does not provide forward-looking guidance on a GAAP basis as discussed below in Fiscal Year 2025 Expectations. Adjusted diluted EPS guidance has been raised from the previous range of $15.15 to $15.45 to a range of $15.25 to $15.55 vs. $15.20 consensus.
